citation.article-title: Saccharibacter floricola gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel osmophilic acetic acid bacterium isolated from pollen
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Saccharibacter floricola sp. nov.
Saccharibacter floricola (flo.ri.co′la. L. n. flos -oris a flower; L. suff. -cola derived from L. n. incola a dweller; N.L. n. floricola flower-dweller).
Has all the characteristics that define the genus.
Strains have been isolated from Japanese flowers.
The type strain is strain S-877T (=AJ 13480T=JCM 12116T=DSM 15669T), which was isolated from pollen collected in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan.
The DNA G+C content of strain S-877T is 52·3 mol%.
